title: WSL clockwatch: Liverpool v Man Utd, Man City v London City Lionesses and more – live
summary: In this week's Clockwatch, a major northwest derby is set to take place in St Helens. Additionally, promoted side London City will face a challenging match in Manchester. Coverage will be provided by Dominic Booth.

title: Aston Villa v Fulham: Premier League – live
summary: Unai Emery's team aims to regain their form in an upcoming match against Fulham. Follow Daniel Harris for a detailed minute-by-minute report on the game. Fans are curious to see if Emery can lead his side to victory.

title: Starmer calls Reform’s policy on immigration ‘racist’ and says Farage’s party would ‘tear country apart’ – Labour conference live
summary: The Prime Minister condemned the Reform party's policy as immoral, expressing concern over its implications. However, he acknowledged that those supporting the party may not be motivated by racism but rather frustration with the current situation. This highlights the complex emotions influencing voter decisions.

title: Premier League top scorers 2025-26: who is leading race for golden boot?
summary: Top scorers in the English Premier League are making headlines this season as they vie for the coveted golden boot. Key players are showcasing exceptional talent and consistency in front of goal. Fans are eagerly watching the race as the competition heats up.

title: UK businesses fear new EHRC guidance on toilets will be ‘unworkable’
summary: Stonewall has alerted ministers that the financial burden of compliance with new regulations could be substantial for companies already facing difficulties. The advocacy group emphasizes that the costs may impact businesses' ability to support LGBTQ+ initiatives. They urge the government to consider the challenges faced by these organizations.
